title: Sony Shifts Strategy to Support MP3 Files (AP)
description: AP - In a major strategic reversal, Sony Corp. said Wednesday it plans to add support for MP3 music files to some of its portable music players.

title: Delta chief warns that bankruptcy is possible
description: Delta Air Lines #39; CEO is cautioning that a tentative pact reached with pilots for a billion dollars in concessions doesn #39;t guarantee the struggling carrier has avoided a possible bankruptcy filing.

title: US launches new Falluja strikes
description: At least seven people are killed in fresh US air strikes on the volatile Iraqi city of Falluja, local medics say.

title: Mets Put Another Dent in Cubs' Hopes (AP)
description: AP - Al Leiter pitched two-hit ball for six innings to earn his first win in six weeks, and the New York Mets put another dent in Chicago's playoff hopes Sunday with a 3-2 victory over the Cubs.

title: Juventus, Lyon qualify from group stage in Champions League
description: Juventus and Olympique Lyon became the third and fourth teams to reach the knockout stage of the European Champions League on Wednesday.

title: MS Rolls Out Second Interim Beta of SQL Server 2005
description: Microsoft Corp. on Friday released its second Community Technology Preview of SQL Server 2005 and rolled out a new, free tool to manage SQL Server 2000 and MSDE (Microsoft Desktop Engine) 2000.

title: Leaders brief parties on talks
description: Some of Northern Ireland #39;s political leaders are to brief party members after talks to restore devolved government ended without a deal.

title: Wal-Mart fires back
description: Wal-Mart Stores Inc. began a statewide offensive Thursday to counter widespread criticism of the company #39;s wages and benefits, expansion plans and effects on communities.

title: First Look: Rio #39;s Hot New Carbon MP3 Player
description: Rio #39;s new 5GB Carbon is the sleekest MP3 player I #39;ve laid eyes on. Happily, the device, which hits stores this week, isn #39;t just about looks: A simple interface and amazing battery life make it the new mini to beat.

title: Asian Stocks Rise in Week, Led by Samsung Electronics, Hon Hai
description: Asian stocks rose for the third week in four, led by gains among electronics makers such as South Korea #39;s Samsung Electronics Co.
